Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer committed a reviewable error in assessing new evidence or breached the duty of fairness by denying an oral hearing
Credibility_Assessment: Kadjo failed to provide credible, previously unavailable information; credibility not sufficiently challenged
Evaluation_Standard: New, credible, and relevant evidence that contradicts material IRB findings
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible and relevant new evidence
No serious issue raised regarding credibility
Review_Outcome: No reviewable error or breach of fairness found
Assessment_Standard: PRRA is not a re-examination of IRB decisions
Application_Factor: Inability to directly address third-party evidence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s.113(a): consideration of new evidence
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient new evidence to contradict IRB findings
Evidentiary_Issues: New evidence not credible or relevant
Procedural_Fairness: Duty of fairness upheld; no breach in denying oral hearing
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's credibility not substantiated with new evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of reviewable error and breach of fairness
